str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
Fitting season, season, opportunity, occasion, time. Of uncertain affinity; an occasion, i.e. Set or proper time.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
When, at which time. From hos and te; at which too, i.e. When.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To endure, bear with, have patience with, suffer, admit, persist.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Feminine Singular
str2: From hugies; to have sound health, i.e. Be well; figuratively, to be uncorrupt.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To rub, tickle, scratch; pass: I itch. From a primary knao; to scratch, i.e. to tickle.
Hearing, faculty of hearing, ear; report, rumor. From akouo; hearing.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To heap up, obtain a multitude of. From epi and soreuo; to accumulate further, i.e. seek additionally.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural

str2: A teacher, master. From didasko; an instructor.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Pertaining to self, i.e. One's own; by implication, private or separate.
Desire, eagerness for, inordinate desire, lust. From epithumeo; a longing.
